page.title: 19THE POW BURN 1
page.content: The burn is an{artifical channel running Westwards across the survey area to a confluence point with the {River Earn,}some 4 miles South East of Crieff. Around{1200}the Pow basin was a marshy lake occupying a large expanse of land with a few small islands dotted along its course. In{1690,}a group of farmers wanted to reclaim and cultivate the marshland and so the Scottish Parliament authorised{"the cutting of a channel 6 {feet deep and 24 feet wide for the {waters of the Pow". }A commission was appointed to tax local landowners for the work of cleaning the Burn. Today the commission employs a contractor to remove weeds from the banks and dredge the channel.
